metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1949 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 44.0.2 does not properly restrict the interaction between Service Workers and plugins, which allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy via a crafted web site that triggers spoofed responses to requests that use NPAPI, as demonstrated by a request for a crossdomain.xml file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1949` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 44.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 44.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 44.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 44.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '44.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
